Name: Omniscien Technologies Language Studio
Price: Depends on configuration and capacity. Different prices for cloud vs on-premise and scale/volumes.
Notes: Hybrid neural machine translation  hybrid deep neural machine translation  syntax-based  rules-based and statistical machine translation. Provides a server platform and a set of desktop tools to aid in translation. Omnscien also offers Machine learning  data cleaning and language processing tools.

Name: Apertium
Platform:
Cross-platform (Web application) Unix compatible
Precompiled packages available for Debian
Notes: Rule-based  shallow transfer; all programs and language data are free and open source

Name: Anusaaraka
Notes: Rule-based  deep parser based  paninian framework based; all programs and language data are free and open-source

Name: IBM
Notes: Both rule-based and statistical models developed by IBM Research. Neural Machine Translation models available through the Watson Language Translator API for developers.<ref></ref><ref></ref>

Name: OpenLogos
Notes: Rule-based  deep transfer

Name: Moses
Notes: Drop-in replacement for Pharaoh  features factored translation models and decoding of confusion networks.

Name: Moses for Mere Mortals
Notes: Free open source; based on Moses; translation memories integration.

Name: NiuTrans
Notes: Competitive performance for Chinese translation tasks; statistical machine translation. Supports phrase-based  hierarchical phrase-based  and syntax-based (string-to-tree  tree-to-string  and tree-to-tree) models for research purposes.

Name: Google Translate
Notes: Statistical and neural machine translation

Name: Bing Translator
Notes: Microsoft's linguistically informed statistical MT system

Name: Yandex.Translate
Notes: Statistical and neural machine translation

Name: SAIC Omnifluent
Notes: Hybrid machine translation combines rule-based machine translation and statistical machine translation  integrated with automatic speech recognition on a single platform that translates text and audio files.<ref></ref><ref></ref>

Name: SYSTRAN
Notes: Hybrid rules-based and SMT

Name: Slate Rocks
Notes: Applications with complete SMT stack run on Windows  Linux and MacOS to build Moses SMT models and integrate with CAT tools.

Name: GramTrans
Notes: Rule-based  using constraint grammar

Name: Promt
Notes: Hybrid rules-based and SMT

Name: SDL Machine Translation
Notes: Neural and Statistical based Machine Translation
